awd_titl_txt: Internet Connection for Grand Rapids Community College
awd_abstract_narration: 9318975  Bergin      Grand Rapids Community College requests support from NSF for  connection of its campus network to NSFNET.  MERIT is the midlevel  network located in the state of Michigan that will provide  operations and network information services.  It will give Grand  Rapids Community College a 56 thousand bits per second connection  to the NSFNET, a high speed (1.5 - 45 million bits per second)  National Backbone network.    The college needs greater functionality and network speed to be  able to access supercomputers, libraries, and make file transfers  along with being able to implement a more reliable mail system.   Students and faculty research will benefit from the link.  This is  also a unique opportunity for the school to explore innovative  educational resources.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division Of Computer and Network Systems
